result.execSummary:
The defendant Katlin Jean Haley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.
Consecutive to 14-CM-186. Huber release and good time granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katlin Jean Haley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Katlin Jean Haley in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Katlin Jean Haley in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Corut reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests a status/plea/sentencing date in August. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/20/15 by Officer Bilodeau. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/20/15)

Defendant Katlin Jean Haley in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Gerbers requests that file continue to track 14-CM-186. Bond remains in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Katlin Jean Haley
Current: 311B Pennsylvania St #B, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 03-20-2015)
Prior: 311B Pennsylvania St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
To be fingerprinted and photographed by next court date.

Defendant Katlin Jean Haley in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers hasn't seen complaint yet, not sure if he'll be representing defendant.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant had some medical issues last week and lost track of the court date. State requests cash bond, makes statement. Atty Gerbers gives argument on bond. Court makes statement, imposes $250 cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.
